UserAccount.title: UserAccount
UserAccount.description: Represents a user account within the application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the user account.

subscriptionStatus.description: The current subscription status of the user (e.g., 'active', 'inactive', 'trial', 'admin').

subscriptionStartDate.description: The date when the user's subscription started.

subscriptionExpiryDate.description: The date when the user's subscription expires.

favoriteLocationIds.description: References to Location. (Relationship: UserAccount N:N Location)

mapIcon.description: The user's chosen icon for the hunting map.

mapColor.description: The user's chosen color for their map icon.

lastSelectedLocation.description: The last location selected by the user.

Location.title: Location
Location.description: Represents a location (commune) selected by the user.

Station.title: Station
Station.description: Represents a tide station with its coordinates.

TideArchive.title: TideArchive
TideArchive.description: Contains the tide events for a specific day and station.

organizerId.description: The UID of the user who created the session.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the session was created.

expiresAt.description: Timestamp when the session expires and should be deleted by TTL.

SessionParticipant.title: SessionParticipant
SessionParticipant.description: Represents a participant in a hunting session.

displayName.description: The display name of the participant.

mapIcon.description: The participant's chosen icon for the hunting map.

mapColor.description: The participant's chosen color for their map icon.

isGibierEnVue.description: Indicates if the participant has game in sight.

AccessToken.title: AccessToken
AccessToken.description: Represents a generated access token for a limited-time subscription.

durationMonths.description: The duration of the subscription in months granted by this token.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the token was created.

status.description: The current status of the token.

redeemedBy.description: The UID of the user who redeemed the token.

redeemedAt.description: Timestamp of when the token was redeemed.

SharedAccessToken.title: SharedAccessToken
SharedAccessToken.description: Represents a globally shared access token that grants access to all users.

durationMonths.description: The duration of the subscription in months granted by this token.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the token was created.

expiresAt.description: Timestamp of when the token expires.

Conversation.title: Conversation
Conversation.description: Represents a single conversation thread between a user and the admin.

userId.description: The UID of the user who initiated the conversation.

userDisplayName.description: The display name of the user.

lastMessageContent.description: A snippet of the latest message for preview.

lastMessageAt.description: Timestamp of the last message sent.

isReadByAdmin.description: True if the admin has read the latest message from the user.

isReadByUser.description: True if the user has read the latest message from the admin.

ChatMessage.title: ChatMessage
ChatMessage.description: Represents a single message within a conversation.

senderId.description: The UID of the sender ('admin' if from the administrator).

content.description: The text content of the message.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the message was sent.

FishingSpot.title: FishingSpot
FishingSpot.description: Represents a saved fishing spot with its environmental context.

userId.description: The UID of the user who saved the spot.

name.description: A name or comment for the spot.

icon.description: The icon chosen for the spot marker.

color.description: The color chosen for the spot marker.

fishingTypes.description: The fishing techniques used at this spot.

context.description: Environmental context at the time of saving.

firestore.reasoning:
This design prioritizes security and scalability for the Marées et Terroir Calédonien application, focusing on user authentication and location data. It leverages path-based ownership for user accounts and separates location data for efficient querying and management. The design emphasizes authorization independence by not relying on `get()` calls in security rules.

**Authorization Independence:** User account data is stored under `/users/{userId}`, ensuring clear ownership and avoiding reliance on external document data for authorization. No data is denormalized as the only relationship is a N:N relationship between user and location and this handled within the user document as an array of IDs.

**Structural Segregation:**  User account data is kept separate from location data, allowing for distinct security rules tailored to each data type.

**QAPs (Query Across Partitions):** Because there are no list operations required for UserAccount collection and favoriteLocationIds only stores the references to existing locations, QAP is automatically supported. List operation on the location data is supported given there is no restriction on listing locations, thus no need to store the role in database.
